Controller used by the Server

    ServerResponse
    handle(MoveMotherNatureRequest req)
    Checks if the player is the current turn owner and if mother nature is allowed to be moved now
    ServerResponse
    handle(MoveStudentRequest req)
    Handle for MoveStudentRequests, checks all possible bad requests (source is an island, trying to steal students from other schoolboards, etc) and in case sends back a KO result.
    ServerResponse
    handle(PassTurnRequest req)
    Handles passing turn, checks if the player is current and if he didn-t play an assistant yet (in this case sets a dummy assistant to avoid null pointer exceptions)

    • handle

      public ServerResponse handle(MoveMotherNatureRequest req)
      Checks if the player is the current turn owner and if mother nature is allowed to be moved now
      Specified by:
      handle in interface ClientRequestHandler
      Parameters:
      req - MoveMotherNatureRequest
      Returns:
      OperationResultResponse

    • handle

      public ServerResponse handle(MoveStudentRequest req)
      Handle for MoveStudentRequests, checks all possible bad requests (source is an island, trying to steal students from other schoolboards, etc) and in case sends back a KO result. If the request is correct and valid, moves the student and send back a OK result with a confirmation message
      Specified by:
      handle in interface ClientRequestHandler
      Parameters:
      req - MoveStudentRequest to handle
      Returns:
      ServerResponse with result and message, depending on the success

    • handle

      public ServerResponse handle(PlayAssistantRequest req)
      Checks if the current phase is planning, if the assistant was already played and if the player is current
      Specified by:
      handle in interface ClientRequestHandler
      Parameters:
      req - PlayAssistantRequest
      Returns:
      OperationResultResponse

    • handle

      public ServerResponse handle(PlayCharacterRequest req)
      Specified by:
      handle in interface ClientRequestHandler
      Parameters:
      req - Full request needed to activate character. Must include at least all the necessary info to activate the effect
      Returns:
      OperationResultResponse with result true if the character was played correctly. False will be returned in these cases: - The player doesn't have enough coins to use it - The character has already been used during this action phase - The player's round has not yet startet

    • handle

      public ServerResponse handle(SetNicknameRequest req)
      Specified by:
      handle in interface ClientRequestHandler
      Parameters:
      req - Request needed to set the nickname. It must contain a nickname.
      Returns:
      SetNicknameResponse with result true if the user is the game creator (the first player to join). False will be returned in case the game has already started and is waiting players

    • handle

      public ServerResponse handle(SetPlayerNumberRequest req)
      Specified by:
      handle in interface ClientRequestHandler
      Parameters:
      req - Request needed to set the player number. It must contain the number of players, the nickname of the game owner and a boolean flag for expert mode.
      Returns:
      OperationResultResponse with result true if the game is created successfully. False in case the game has already started during this phase (in this case, the requesting user is set as a normal player and is not the owner)

    • handle

      public ServerResponse handle(GetUpdatedBoardRequest req)
      Specified by:
      handle in interface ClientRequestHandler
      Parameters:
      req - Request needed to get a reduced and updated game model. It must contain the nickname of the requesting player
      Returns:
      GetUpdatedBoardResponse containing a reduced version of the game, in order to correctly visualize the game status in the client view (CLI or GUI)

    • handle

      public ServerResponse handle(PassTurnRequest req)
      Handles passing turn, checks if the player is current and if he didn-t play an assistant yet (in this case sets a dummy assistant to avoid null pointer exceptions)
      Specified by:
      handle in interface ClientRequestHandler
      Parameters:
      req - PassTurnRequest
      Returns:
      OperationResultResponse

      Waits until all the players have connected
      Specified by:
      handle in interface ClientRequestHandler
      Parameters:
      req - WaitingRequest
      Returns:
      OperationResultResponse
